inclusion.criterion: Male or non-pregnant female patient, 18 years or older
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients admitted to Cardiology or Internal Medicine units with a diagnosis of acute decompensated heart failure and congestion: NT-proBNP > 1,000 pg/ml or BNP >250 pg/ml,
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: dyspnea and at least two of the following clinical signs: 2+ pitting edema, pulmonary edema/pleural effusions at chest x-ray or US body weight increase above usual > 5% over the last 4 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Clinically stable patients that can be switched to oral diuretic therapy after 24-72 hours of an algorithm-based treatment with high-dose intravenous furosemide started at the time of hospital admission
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients capable to provide written informed consent
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Serum creatinine levels > 3.5 mg per deciliter at admission to the hospital or usual estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 20 ml/min/1.73 m2 by the MDRD or CKD-EPI formula
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg at time of enrollment and/or hemodynamic instability severe enough to require intravenous inotropes, intravenous vasodilators, or both
exclusion.label: unknown
